title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement codeofconduct@posit.co. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Contributing to survtrans
text: outlines propose change survtrans. detailed discussion contributing tidyverse packages, please see development contributing guide code review principles.

title: Contributing to survtrans
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to survtrans
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed). See guide create great issue advice.

title: Contributing to survtrans
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("SignorinoY/survtrans", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to survtrans
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to survtrans
text: Please note survtrans project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

Typically don’t look repo sufficient quantity issues accumulates, ’s burst intense activity focus efforts. makes development efficient avoids expensive context switching problems, cost taking longer get back . process makes good reprex particularly important might multiple months initial report start working . can’t reproduce bug, can’t fix !

title: A Review of Transfer Learning Approaches for Survival Analysis
text: Consider scenario survival data multiple source domains want transfer survival information target domain. vignette, review transfer learning approaches survival analysis.
code: formula <- survival::Surv(time, status) ~ . - group - id df_target <- sim2[sim2$group == 1, ]

title: A Review of Transfer Learning Approaches for Survival Analysis
A Review of Transfer Learning Approaches for Survival Analysis
A Review of Transfer Learning Approaches for Survival Analysis
Authors and Citation
text: Ziyang Gong. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Gong Z (2025). survtrans: Transfer Learning Survival Analysis. R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://github.com/SignorinoY/survtrans.
code: @Manual{,   title = {survtrans: Transfer Learning for Survival Analysis},   author = {Ziyang Gong},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://github.com/SignorinoY/survtrans}, }

title: Transfer Learning for Survival Analysis
text: goal survtrans provide framework transferring survival information source domain(s) target domain. package currently supports Cox proportional hazards model global local transfer learning.

title: Transfer Learning for Survival Analysis
text: can install development version survtrans :

title: Transfer Learning for Survival Analysis
text: basic example showing transfer survival information multiple source domains target domain using Cox proportional hazards model: can also plot estimated cumulative baseline hazard function compare true function:
code: library(survtrans) formula <- survival::Surv(time, status) ~ . - group - id fit <- coxtrans(   formula, sim2, sim2$group, 1,   lambda1 = 0.075, lambda2 = 0.04, lambda3 = 0.04, penalty = "SCAD" ) summary(fit) #> Call: #> coxtrans(formula = formula, data = sim2, group = sim2$group,  #>     target = 1, lambda1 = 0.075, lambda2 = 0.04, lambda3 = 0.04,  #>     penalty = "SCAD") #>  #>   n=500, number of events=422 #>  #>       coef exp(coef) se(coef)     z Pr(>|z|)     #> X1 0.35052   1.41981  0.05366 6.533 6.47e-11 *** #> X2 0.35914   1.43209  0.05424 6.621 3.56e-11 *** #> X3 0.34485   1.41178  0.05431 6.350 2.15e-10 *** #> X4 0.32870   1.38916  0.05190 6.333 2.40e-10 *** #> --- #> Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1 #>    exp(coef) exp(-coef) lower .95 upper .95 #> X1 1.4198    0.7043     1.2781    1.5773    #> X2 1.4321    0.6983     1.2877    1.5927    #> X3 1.4118    0.7083     1.2692    1.5703    #> X4 1.3892    0.7199     1.2548    1.5379 library(ggplot2) basehaz_pred <- basehaz(fit) basehaz_pred$color <- ifelse(   as.numeric(basehaz_pred$strata) %% 2 == 0, "Group 2", "Group 1" ) ggplot(   basehaz_pred,   aes(     x = time,     y = basehaz,     group = strata,     color = factor(color),     linetype = "Estimates"   ) ) +   geom_line() +   geom_line(     aes(x = time, y = time^2 / 2, color = "Group 1", linetype = "True")   ) +   geom_line(     aes(x = time, y = time^3 / 3, color = "Group 2", linetype = "True")   ) +   labs(     title = "Cumulative Baseline Hazard Function (Estimated vs. True)",     x = expression(t),     y = expression(Lambda[0](t))   ) +   scale_linetype_manual(values = c("Estimates" = "dashed", "True" = "solid")) +   guides(     color = guide_legend(title = "Strata"),     linetype = guide_legend(title = "Type")   )

title: Transfer Learning for Cox Model with Global and Local Shrinkage — coxtrans
code: coxtrans(   formula,   data,   group,   target,   lambda1 = 0,   lambda2 = 0,   lambda3 = 0,   penalty = c("lasso", "MCP", "SCAD"),   gamma = switch(penalty, SCAD = 3.7, MCP = 3, 1),   rho = 2,   tau = 10,   init,   control,   ... )

title: Transfer Learning for Cox Model with Global and Local Shrinkage — coxtrans
text: formula formula object, response left ~ operator, terms right. response must survival object returned Surv function. data data frame containing variables model. group factor variable indicating group observation. target character string specifying target group. lambda1 non-negative value specifying sparse penalty parameter. default 0. lambda2 non-negative value specifying global biased penalty parameter. default 0. lambda3 non-negative value specifying local biased penalty parameter. default 0. penalty character string specifying penalty function. default "lasso". options "MCP" "SCAD". gamma non-negative value specifying penalty parameter. default 3.7 SCAD 3.0 MCP. rho value larger 1 specifying increase/decrease factor augmented Lagrangian's penalty parameter. default 2.0. tau value larger 1 specifying tolerance trade-primal dual residuals. default 10.0. init numeric vector initial values coefficients. default zero vector. control object class survtrans_control containing control parameters fitting algorithm. Default survtrans_control(...). ... Additional arguments passed fitting algorithm.

title: Compute penalty for a numeric vector using specified regularization type. — penalty
Compute penalty for a numeric vector using specified regularization type. — penalty
text: x numeric vector penalty computed. penalty character string specifying penalty type. Valid options "lasso", "MCP", "SCAD". lambda numeric value representing regularization parameter. gamma numeric value used penalty MCP SCAD.

title: Compute penalty for a numeric vector using specified regularization type. — penalty
text: numeric value representing computed penalty.

title: Compute penalty for a numeric vector using specified regularization type. — penalty
text: computation differs according penalty type: lasso Returns L1 norm x scaled lambda. MCP Applies minimax concave penalty penalty function behaves linearly absolute values lambda * gamma quadratically otherwise. SCAD Applies smoothly clipped absolute deviation penalty; different expressions used abs(x) lambda, lambda gamma * lambda, thresholds.

title: Preprocess Survival Data — preprocess
text: function preprocesses survival data Cox transfer analysis. performs several steps including extracting response covariates model frame, standardizing covariates, ensuring validity offsets grouping, sorting data survival time descending order.

title: Preprocess Survival Data — preprocess
Preprocess Survival Data — preprocess
text: formula formula specifying survival model (e.g., Surv(time, status) ~ covariates). data data frame containing variables referenced formula. group Optional grouping vector. offset Optional offset vector.

title: Preprocess Survival Data — preprocess
text: list following components: x matrix standardized covariates. time vector survival times, sorted descending order. status vector censoring indicators, corresponding sorted survival times. group factor vector representing group classification sample, sorted time. offset numeric vector representing offsets sample, sorted time.

title: Preprocess Survival Data — preprocess
text: function first creates model frame provided formula data, extracts response variable, contain survival time censoring status. covariates extracted using model matrix standardized using scale function. function also checks group offset arguments, assigning default values provided. Finally, components (time, status, covariates, group, offset) sorted descending order based survival time.

Coefficients: regression coefficients, standard errors, z-values, p-values, formatted table. Significance stars shown next p-values signif.stars TRUE. Confidence intervals: exponentiated coefficients along confidence intervals.

what: Simulated Group Survival Data: Multiple-source Transfer Learning — sim2
title: Simulated Group Survival Data: Multiple-source Transfer Learning — sim2
text: dataset containing survival data 5 groups, part effects baseline hazards heterogeneous. group consists 100 individuals. survival time \(T\) group \(\) generated according following model: $$     \lambda^{()}(t)=\lambda_{0,}(t)\exp\left(x^\top\beta^{()}\right), $$ \(\lambda_{0,}(t)\) represents baseline hazard group \(\), \(\beta^{()}\) represents effects group \(\), \(x\) represents covariates. covariates \(x=(x_{1},\ldots,x_{20})\) generated multivariate normal distribution mean 0 covariance matrix \(\Sigma=I_{20}\). baseline hazard function defined : $$     \lambda_{0,}(t)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}         t^{2}, & \text{} =1,3,5 \\         t,     & \text{} =2,4.     \end{array}\right. $$ effects defined : $$     \beta^{()}=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}         (0.3,0.3,0.3,0.3,0,\ldots,0),   & \text{} =1, \\         (0.9,0.9,0.3,0.3,0,\ldots,0), & \text{} =2,4, \\         (-0.3,-0.3,0.3,0.3,0,\ldots,0), & \text{} =3,5.     \end{array}\right. $$ maximum censoring time fixed 2, approximate censoring rate 20%.

title: Simulated Group Survival Data: Multiple-source Transfer Learning — sim2
text: data frame 500 rows 24 variables: id Individual identifier, 1-500 group Group indicator, 1-5 time Survival time status Status indicator, 0=censored, 1=event X1 Covariate 1 X2 Covariate 2 X3 Covariate 3 X4 Covariate 4 X5 Covariate 5 X6 Covariate 6 X7 Covariate 7 X8 Covariate 8 X9 Covariate 9 X10 Covariate 10 X11 Covariate 11 X12 Covariate 12 X13 Covariate 13 X14 Covariate 14 X15 Covariate 15 X16 Covariate 16 X17 Covariate 17 X18 Covariate 18 X19 Covariate 19 X20 Covariate 20

title: Simulated Group Survival Data: Multiple-source Transfer Learning — sim2
text: ../articles/simulate-data.html

code: simsurv_tl(beta, eta, lambda, gamma, dist, maxt, n_samples, seed = 0)

title: Simulate survival data for a multi-source Cox model — simsurv_tl
text: beta vector length p representing common coefficients, p number features. eta matrix size p x K representing group-specific coefficients, K number groups. lambda vector length K representing baseline hazard's scale parameters. gamma vector length K representing baseline hazard's shape parameters. dist string specifying distribution baseline hazard, either "exponential", "weibull", "gompertz". maxt positive number specifying maximum time simulate. n_samples vector length K specifying number samples per group, single number specifying total number samples. seed integer specifying random seed, default value 0.

title: Simulate survival data for a multi-source Cox model — simsurv_tl
text: data frame columns "id", "group", "X1", "X2", ..., "Xp", "time", "status".

title: Simulate survival data for a multi-source Cox model — simsurv_tl

what: survtrans: Transfer Learning for Survival Analysis — survtrans-package
title: survtrans: Transfer Learning for Survival Analysis — survtrans-package
text: Transfer learning survival analysis. package provides framework transferring survival information source domain(s) target domain. package now supports Cox proportional hazards model global local transfer learning.

title: survtrans: Transfer Learning for Survival Analysis — survtrans-package
text: Maintainer: Ziyang Gong gongziyang@smail.swufe.edu.cn (ORCID)

text: Ancillary arguments controlling survtrans fitting

title: Ancillary arguments for controlling survtrans fitting — survtrans_control
Ancillary arguments for controlling survtrans fitting — survtrans_control
text: abstol absolute tolerance proposed algorithm. Default 1e-4. reltol relative tolerance proposed algorithm. Default 1e-3. maxit maximum number iterations proposed algorithm. Default 300. verbose logical value indicating whether print messages fitting process. Default FALSE.
